segment.source: Checklist Configuring Rules for Servers in a Standalone Isolated Server Zone (Windows 10)
segment.target: Checklist Configuring Rules for Servers in a Standalone Isolated Server Zone (Windows 10)

segment.source: Checklist Configuring Rules for Servers in a Standalone Isolated Server Zone
segment.target: Checklist Configuring Rules for Servers in a Standalone Isolated Server Zone

segment.source: Checklist: Configuring Rules for Servers in a Standalone Isolated Server Zone
segment.target: Checklist: Configuring Rules for Servers in a Standalone Isolated Server Zone

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: This checklist includes tasks for configuring connection security rules and IPsec settings in your GPOs for servers in a standalone isolated server zone that is not part of an isolated domain.
segment.target: This checklist includes tasks for configuring connection security rules and IPsec settings in your GPOs for servers in a standalone isolated server zone that is not part of an isolated domain.

segment.source: In addition to requiring authentication and optionally encryption, servers in a server isolation zone are accessible only by users or devices that are authenticated as members of a network access group (NAG).
segment.target: In addition to requiring authentication and optionally encryption, servers in a server isolation zone are accessible only by users or devices that are authenticated as members of a network access group (NAG).

segment.source: The GPOs described here apply only to the isolated servers, not to the client devices that connect to them.
segment.target: The GPOs described here apply only to the isolated servers, not to the client devices that connect to them.

segment.source: For the GPOs for the client devices, see Checklist: Creating Rules for Clients of a Standalone Isolated Server Zone.
segment.target: For the GPOs for the client devices, see Checklist: Creating Rules for Clients of a Standalone Isolated Server Zone.

segment.source: The GPOs for isolated servers are similar to those for an isolated domain.
segment.target: The GPOs for isolated servers are similar to those for an isolated domain.

segment.source: This checklist refers you to those procedures for the creation of some of the rules.
segment.target: This checklist refers you to those procedures for the creation of some of the rules.

segment.source: The other procedures in this checklist are for creating the restrictions that allow only members of the server access group to connect to the server.
segment.target: The other procedures in this checklist are for creating the restrictions that allow only members of the server access group to connect to the server.

segment.source: Checklist: Configuring rules for isolated servers
segment.target: Checklist: Configuring rules for isolated servers

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: Create a GPO for the devices that need to have access restricted to the same set of client devices.
segment.target: Create a GPO for the devices that need to have access restricted to the same set of client devices.

segment.source: If there are multiple servers running different versions of the Windows operating system, start by creating the GPO for one version of Windows.
segment.target: If there are multiple servers running different versions of the Windows operating system, start by creating the GPO for one version of Windows.

segment.source: After you have finished the tasks in this checklist and configured the GPO for that version of Windows, you can create a copy of it.
segment.target: After you have finished the tasks in this checklist and configured the GPO for that version of Windows, you can create a copy of it.

segment.source: Checklist: Creating Group Policy Objects
segment.target: Checklist: Creating Group Policy Objects

segment.source: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO
segment.target: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO

segment.source: If you are working on a copy of a GPO, modify the group memberships and WMI filters so that they are correct for the devices for which this GPO is intended.
segment.target: If you are working on a copy of a GPO, modify the group memberships and WMI filters so that they are correct for the devices for which this GPO is intended.

segment.source: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows
segment.target: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows

segment.source: Configure IPsec to exempt all ICMP network traffic from IPsec protection.
segment.target: Configure IPsec to exempt all ICMP network traffic from IPsec protection.

segment.source: Exempt ICMP from Authentication
segment.target: Exempt ICMP from Authentication

segment.source: Create a rule that exempts all network traffic to and from devices on the exemption list from IPsec.
segment.target: Create a rule that exempts all network traffic to and from devices on the exemption list from IPsec.

segment.source: Create an Authentication Exemption List Rule
segment.target: Create an Authentication Exemption List Rule

segment.source: Configure the key exchange (main mode) security methods and algorithms to be used.
segment.target: Configure the key exchange (main mode) security methods and algorithms to be used.

segment.source: Configure Key Exchange (Main Mode) Settings
segment.target: Configure Key Exchange (Main Mode) Settings

segment.source: Configure the data protection (quick mode) algorithm combinations to be used.
segment.target: Configure the data protection (quick mode) algorithm combinations to be used.

segment.source: Configure Data Protection (Quick Mode) Settings
segment.target: Configure Data Protection (Quick Mode) Settings

segment.source: Configure the authentication methods to be used.
segment.target: Configure the authentication methods to be used.

segment.source: This procedure sets the default settings for the device.
segment.target: This procedure sets the default settings for the device.

segment.source: If you want to set authentication on a per-rule basis, this procedure is optional.
segment.target: If you want to set authentication on a per-rule basis, this procedure is optional.

segment.source: Configure Authentication Methods
segment.target: Configure Authentication Methods

segment.source: Create a rule that requests authentication for all inbound network traffic.
segment.target: Create a rule that requests authentication for all inbound network traffic.

segment.source: Important: Just as in an isolated domain, do not set the rules to require authentication until your testing is complete.
segment.target: Important: Just as in an isolated domain, do not set the rules to require authentication until your testing is complete.

segment.source: That way, if the rules do not work as expected, communications are not affected by a failure to authenticate.
segment.target: That way, if the rules do not work as expected, communications are not affected by a failure to authenticate.

segment.source: Create an Authentication Request Rule
segment.target: Create an Authentication Request Rule

segment.source: If your design requires encryption in addition to authentication for access to the isolated servers, then modify the rule to require it.
segment.target: If your design requires encryption in addition to authentication for access to the isolated servers, then modify the rule to require it.

segment.source: Configure the Rules to Require Encryption
segment.target: Configure the Rules to Require Encryption

segment.source: Create the NAG to contain the device or user accounts that are allowed to access the isolated servers.
segment.target: Create the NAG to contain the device or user accounts that are allowed to access the isolated servers.

segment.source: If you have multiple groups of isolated servers that are accessed by different client devices, then create a NAG for each set of servers.
segment.target: If you have multiple groups of isolated servers that are accessed by different client devices, then create a NAG for each set of servers.

segment.source: Create a Group Account in Active Directory
segment.target: Create a Group Account in Active Directory

segment.source: Create a firewall rule that allows inbound network traffic only if it is authenticated from a user or device that is a member of the zone’s NAG.
segment.target: Create a firewall rule that allows inbound network traffic only if it is authenticated from a user or device that is a member of the zone’s NAG.

segment.source: Restrict Server Access to Members of a Group Only
segment.target: Restrict Server Access to Members of a Group Only

segment.source: Link the GPO to the domain level of the Active Directory organizational unit hierarchy.
segment.target: Link the GPO to the domain level of the Active Directory organizational unit hierarchy.

segment.source: Link the GPO to the Domain
segment.target: Link the GPO to the Domain

segment.source: Add your test server to the membership group for the isolated server zone.
segment.target: Add your test server to the membership group for the isolated server zone.

segment.source: Be sure to add at least one for each operating system supported by a different GPO in the group.
segment.target: Be sure to add at least one for each operating system supported by a different GPO in the group.

segment.source: Add Test Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone
segment.target: Add Test Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone

segment.source: Do not change the rules for any of your zones to require authentication until all zones have been set up and thoroughly tested.
segment.target: Do not change the rules for any of your zones to require authentication until all zones have been set up and thoroughly tested.
